(1, 1, 1): FAO (2007): not at risk, RBST (2017): Category 6
(2, 1, 1): Male: 54 to 82 kg (120 to 180 lb), Female: 36 to 54 kg (80 to 120 lb)
(3, 1, 1): piebald   black or grey with white patches
(4, 1, 1): badger-faced   black cheeks and muzzle, white blaze
(5, 1, 1): horned in both sexes; may have two or four horns
